column4: This system has one IDE hard drive. But I'm looking under /dev and all I'm finding are things pointing to sda sda1 sda2 and so on. Why is that?
sda is your first harddrive, sda2 is the second partition on your first drive.
So why are they called sda instead of hda?
There was a kernel change a few releases ago that changed that.  I don't have a link handy though.
